By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 030215 ZSM, a special permit shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 030214 ZMM which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 2-10 West End Ave., Manhattan (030215ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Quinn:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 255 Bleeker Street, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 2, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20045365 TCM.)
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café located at 255 Bleeker St, Manhattan (20045365TCM)

Items.Title: Roll Call
Roll Call
Resolution calling upon federal, state and local officials, and upon New York City agencies and institutions, to affirm and uphold civil rights and civil liberties.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidred - Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice-vote.  The following 13 Council Members formally objected to the passage of this item: Council Members Addabbo Jr., Avella, Felder, Gallagher, Gennaro, Gentile, Jennings, Lanza, Nelson, Recchia, Sears, Vallone Jr., and Oddo.  The following Council Member chose to formally abstain on this item: Council Member Fidler.
Items.MatterName: Federal, state and local officials, and upon NYC agencies and institutions, to affirm and uphold civil rights and civil liberties.

Items.Title: General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a pest control board.
Items.MatterName: Creation of a pest control board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the Department of Education, in consultation with the New York City Police Department, to install security cameras at New York City public schools.
Items.MatterName: DOE and NYPD to install video security cameras at all entrance and exit doors of each NYC public school.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to dumping snow and ice from piers.
Items.MatterName: Dumping snow and ice from piers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the storage of salt for purposes of snow removal.
Items.MatterName: Storage of salt for purposes of snow removal.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing on-site disposal of storm water runoff to improve the quality of New York city waters and enhance the potential for recreational use of the city's waterfronts.
Items.MatterName: Allowing on-site disposal of storm water runoff.

Items.MinutesNote:

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
